actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.

actions.subcommittee: the Civil Service and Agency Organization
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on the Civil Service and Agency Organization.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Civil Service and Agency Organization

official_title: To provide that benefits under chapter 89 of title 5, United States Code, may be afforded for covered services provided by a licensed or certified acupuncturist, massage therapist, naturopathic physician, or midwife, without supervision or referral by another health practitioner.
short_title: Alternative Medical Access for Federal Employees Act of 2001

summary.text: Alternative Medical Access for Federal Employees Act of 2001 - Allows a person to select, have direct access to, and receive payment or reimbursement for covered services provided under the Federal Employees Health Benefits program by a licensed or certified acupuncturist, massage therapist, naturopathic physician, or midwife, without supervision or referral by another health practitioner.

titles.title: Alternative Medical Access for Federal Employees Act of 2001

To provide that benefits under chapter 89 of title 5, United States Code, may be afforded for covered services provided by a licensed or certified acupuncturist, massage therapist, naturopathic physician, or midwife, without supervision or referral by another health practitioner.
